description:
We have a number of affiliate links on our site that users click on to to make purchases, the money then gets kicked back to us for the purchase which we then share with the originating purchaser/user.

What we require is a cross platform plugin - if this is not possible a plugin for each - for the major browsers, primarily Windows Explorer, Google Chrome, Firefox and Safari, where a user no longer needs to make purchases via our site to get the affiliate payment share, but instead the plugin should be able to (I would imagine via database of sites that we would add) know that the user is on a certain site - for this example say the Apple site - and if a purchase is made, use 'our' affiliate link for that purchase (obviously all the user would know and opt into this service). This way, we still receive the affiliate money even if they have forgotten to shop via our site (which is a major problem) which we can then share with the user.

For information the system would need to be able to tie into our existing Drupal 7 website. However, please note we do have expert Drupal/PHP developers so might only need someone that can develop the plugin, which we can then integrate.
title: Browser Plugin for Tracking Affiliate Purchases

assignments.title: Drupal 7 - Custom Module for Survey Requirements
Require a optimised Drupal 7 secure server that can also serve LimeSurvey surveys.

assignments.comment: Excellent Client, i hope work with he in future.
assignments.title: Mobile Navigation CSS Fix - Drupal Site
